title: How to Make Mushroom Rigatoni

steps.headline: Cook the rigatoni pasta according to the package directions, reserving 3/4 cup of the cooking water.
steps.description: After the pasta is tender, drain it and return it to the pot.

steps.headline: Boil dried mushrooms in 2 cups of boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender.
steps.description: After draining, squeeze the mushrooms, removing additional liquid; finely chop mushrooms.

steps.headline: Cook fresh mushrooms in olive oil over medium-high heat (do this in a medium skillet).
steps.description: Do this for about 5 minutes, or until liquid is evaporated.

steps.headline: Heat the alfredo sauce for about 7 to 10 minutes.
steps.description: Do this in a medium non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add mushrooms, parsley, and garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper.

steps.headline: Combine the rigatoni pasta and alfredo sauce mixture.

text: Cook the rigatoni pasta according to the package directions, reserving 3/4 cup of the cooking water. After the pasta is tender, drain it and return it to the pot. Boil dried mushrooms in 2 cups of boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender. After draining, squeeze the mushrooms, removing additional liquid; finely chop mushrooms. Cook fresh mushrooms in olive oil over medium-high heat (do this in a medium skillet). Do this for about 5 minutes, or until liquid is evaporated. Heat the alfredo sauce for about 7 to 10 minutes. Do this in a medium non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add mushrooms, parsley, and garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper. Combine the rigatoni pasta and alfredo sauce mixture.  Serve immediately.
